title: Reporter loses it on air after Australia wins World Cup qualifier
description: Australian reporter Tony Armstrong had an elated reaction on live TV when the Australian soccer team, the Socceroos, had a dramatic win against Peru to qualify to go to the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.

title: The 22 wildest lines from Trump's 12-page statement on the Jan. 6 committee
description:
• Analysis: Suddenly the Jan. 6 committee looks divided
• William Barr's stunning evolution from Trump loyalist to nemesis

title: Björn Ulvaeus on new ABBA show: 'It's absolutely mind-blowing'
description: ABBA founding member Björn Ulvaeus speaks with Bianna Golodryga about the group's groundbreaking new stage show and becoming an "ABBA-tar".

title: Russia is 'hemorrhaging' millionaires
description: Millionaires are leaving Russia in droves after the country invaded Ukraine and the West imposed sanctions.

title: Trevor Reed files petition against Russia with UN, asking his detention be declared unlawful, he tells CNN
description: Trevor Reed, the American veteran who spent nearly three years in a Russian prison, has filed a petition with the United Nations declaring Russia violated international law with his detention and poor treatment, he told CNN Tuesday.

title: Brittney Griner's detention in Russia extended through at least July 2, Russian state news reports
description: US basketball star Brittney Griner -- who has been held in Russia since February on accusations of drug smuggling -- will remain in Russian custody through at least July 2, after a Russian court extended her detention, Russian state news agency TASS reported Tuesday.

title: Alexey Navalny's legal team 'searching' for him after prison transfer
description: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny has been transferred from the penal colony where he was  serving his term to a higher security prison facility, his lawyer told CNN Tuesday.

title: Unprecedented flooding conditions force Yellowstone National Park to close all entrances and leave locals trapped
description: Yellowstone National Park will remain closed to visitors through at least Wednesday due to dangerous flooding conditions, which have prompted park evacuations and left some in surrounding communities trapped without safe drinking water, officials say.

title: Jennifer Lopez's 'Halftime' is too much of a licensed product to feel particularly super
description: "Halftime" could have just as easily been titled "The Importance of Being J-Lo," focusing on Jennifer Lopez's life and career, somewhat arbitrarily, through a particularly busy, high-profile stretch in 2019 and early 2020. Although the documentary fritters around the edges of being interesting, it's too much of a licensed product to deliver any grand insights.

title: Elon Musk is set to take questions from Twitter employees for first time
description: Elon Musk is set to field questions directly from Twitter employees later this week for the first time since he agreed to buy the social media company.

title: US expects announcements of more weapons to Ukraine in meeting of nearly 50 countries
description: The US expects more announcements of weapons and equipment packages to be sent to Ukraine to help in its fight against Russia at a meeting of nearly 50 countries in Brussels on Wednesday, according to a senior US defense official.

title: Amber Heard says she will stand by her testimony to her 'dying day'
description: Amber Heard has spoken out about everything from the public's treatment of her during her defamation trial with ex-husband Johnny Depp to whether she was telling the truth about his alleged abuse.

title: A hostel that housed Rwanda genocide survivors prepares to take in people deported by the UK
description: Hope Hostel is not a 5-star hotel. But it isn't a dump, either. The renovated 50-room facility in Kigali's Kagugu neighborhood has a new coat of paint, fresh bedding, a lot of new security cameras and a changed mission. After hosting student survivors of the 1994 genocide for nearly three decades, it will be the first home for migrants deported from the United Kingdom.

title: Why cats go so crazy for catnip
description: Catnip isn't just intensely pleasurable for cats. It's also practical.

title: How a new library sheds light on the US 'secret war' in Laos
description: Most Americans learn something about the Vietnam War at school. Fewer learn about the shadow war that was being fought alongside it.

title: Lizzo changed 'Grrrls' lyric after backlash
description: Lizzo announced she has edited one of her songs after complaints from some in the disabled community.

title: Serena Williams handed wild card entry for Wimbledon return
description: Seven-time Wimbledon champion Serena Williams appeared to indicate that she will make her much-anticipated return to competition when the tournament kicks off later this month.

title: Watch moment house collapses into flood water
description: The Yellowstone River swelled to a record high due to recent heavy rainfall and runoff from melting snow.

title: John Stamos 'disappointed' In Memoriam tribute at Tonys didn't include Bob Saget
description: John Stamos wanted his friend Bob Saget included in the In Memoriam segment during Sunday's Tony Awards.

title: Former tennis player Jelena Dokic says she came close to taking her own life
description: Former Australian tennis player Jelena Dokic said she "almost jumped off my 26th floor balcony and took my own life" in a candid, emotional Instagram post on Monday.

title: Woman clings to tree in canal for hours after trying to save her dog
description: Authorities in Arizona released video of a woman who was rescued after spending 18 hours in a canal after she got stuck while trying to rescue her dog.

title: US Air Force clears crew after human remains found on plane after Afghan evacuation flight
description: The US Air Force has concluded that a C-17 aircraft crew operating out of Kabul's airport in Afghanistan during the chaotic evacuation of American forces acted appropriately in departing the airport even though human remains were discovered in the wheel well when the plane landed in Qatar.

title: Phil Mickelson has 'deep empathy' for 9/11 victims after he's criticized for joining Saudi-backed LIV Golf series
description: Phil Mickelson says he has "deep empathy" for the victims of the 9/11 terror attacks following criticism of the 51-year-old and other US golfers for joining the controversial Saudi-backed LIV Golf series.

title: Ukraine war 'perhaps in some way either provoked or not prevented,' says Pope Francis
description: Pope Francis has said that the war in Ukraine "was perhaps in some way either provoked or not prevented" in remarks published by Italian newspaper La Stampa on Tuesday.

title: Coinbase lays off 18% of its workforce and warns of 'crypto winter'
description: Crypto exchange Coinbase is laying off 18% of its employees as the digital currency market continues to crumble.

title: Putin unveils imperialist mission: taking back land he says is Russia's
description: Russian president Vladimir Putin has shifted his rhetoric on the invasion of Ukraine -- from "denazifying Ukraine" at the initial stage to a complete land takeover in an imperial style. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports.

title: Google, Facebook, Twitter to tackle deepfakes or risk EU fines
description: Alphabet Inc unit Google (GOOGL), Facebook Inc (META), Twitter Inc (TWTR) and other tech companies will have to take measures to counter deepfakes and fake accounts on their platforms or risk hefty fines under an updated European Union code of practice, according to an EU document seen by Reuters.

title: Hunter Biden's ex-wife Kathleen Buhle says she had no knowledge of ex-husband's financial dealings
description: Kathleen Buhle, the ex-wife of Hunter Biden, said in an interview Tuesday that she had no control over her finances when she was married, and that she allowed Hunter Biden to make their financial decisions.

title: How Pride events nationally are responding after a White supremacist group allegedly planned to riot in Idaho
description: With Pride celebrations scheduled throughout the month in cities big and small across the country, organizers and police departments are taking a close look at their safety plans.

title: Biden to visit Israel and Saudi Arabia, determining it's time to engage kingdom he once called a 'pariah'
description: President Joe Biden will visit Saudi Arabia next month, the White House announced Tuesday, a foreign policy trade-off that completes the reversal of his campaign pledge to make the kingdom a "pariah."

title: Justin Bieber offers an update on his facial paralysis
description: Justin Bieber has shared a faith-filled update about a rare medical condition that has resulted in one side of his face being paralyzed.

title: Mbongeni Buthelezi: The South African artist turning plastic into portraits
description: While other artists might use watercolors or oil paints, Mbongeni Buthelezi uses waste plastics to create highly textured portraits at his studio in Booysens, Johannesburg.

title: 'It's a grift': Lofgren tells Tapper Trump campaign bilked donors
description: January 6 committee member Rep. Zoe Lofgren (D-CA) presented a video that accused former President Donald Trump and his campaign of pushing false election claims to raise money to fight voter fraud that did not exist.

title: Here's what it might be like to travel on a double decker airplane seat
description: Flying economy for any extended period of time is an experience usually endured rather than enjoyed, but one airplane seat designer reckons his design could revolutionize budget travel.

title: Hubble spies stellar 'ghost' wandering the Milky Way galaxy
description: For the first time, the Hubble Space Telescope has detected a lone object drifting through our Milky Way galaxy -- the invisible, ghostly remains of a once radiant star.

title: Where do you put your money in a bear market? Try wine, art and baseball cards
description: US markets are hurting, and investors are panicked.

title: What happens if you wake up before your alarm? Tips from 3 sleep experts
description: Many people dread the blaring sound of an alarm clock, signaling the start of a busy workday. Others wish that they weren't already awake and that the sound had actually woken them up.

title: Hear what asylum-seekers in Calais think about Britain's controversial new policy
description: The British government is to send some asylum-seekers that arrive in Britain to Rwanda, in a controversial policy that they say aims to disrupt people-smuggling networks and deter migrants from making the dangerous Channel crossing from Europe. CNN's Nada Bashir visited a refugee camp in Calais, France, and spoke to some asylum-seekers.

title: Sacrificial altar among 13,000 relics unearthed at Sanxingdui archaeological site in China
description: A turtleshell-shaped box and a sacrificial altar are among a treasure trove of 13,000 relics dating back over 3,000 years discovered by archaeologists in southwest China.

title: 'We're still recovering': 11 years after Fukushima nuclear disaster, residents return to their village
description: More than 11 years after Japan's worst nuclear disaster, the government lifted evacuation orders in part of a heavily contaminated village on Sunday, allowing residents to move back into their homes.

title: The brides taking wedding dresses to the extreme
description: Wedding season is in full swing after two years of delayed or pared down "micro" ceremonies, and one thing is clear: Classic is out, wear-what-you-want is in.

title: Japan makes 'online insults' punishable
description: Japan's parliament on Monday passed legislation making "online insults" punishable by imprisonment amid rising public concern over cyberbullying sparked by the suicide of a reality television star who had faced social media abuse.

title: Australian teenager charged with printing a 'fully functioning' 3D firearm
description: An Australian teenager has been charged with gun offenses after police seized a fully functioning firearm he allegedly made at home with a 3D printer.

title: Australia reaches World Cup finals with goalkeeper's shootout win over Peru
description: Australia's dancing substitute goalkeeper Andrew Redmayne saved the last penalty to clinch a place at this year's World Cup in Qatar as it edged Peru 5-4 in a shootout following a 0-0 draw after extra time in an inter-continental playoff on Monday.
